image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue blazer.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC under a freedom of information request reveal that a complaint about Leanne Castley was formally lodged on June 25, though it was later withdrawn.

title.children: Complaint lodged then withdrawn against ACT Opposition Leader

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: A prisoner has been sentenced to additional jail time, after admitting to biting off part of the ear of another inmate during a fight after a volleyball game.

title.children: Prisoner sentenced after biting off inmate's ear after volleyball game

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete court building.

props.synopsis: Details of a sophisticated drug distribution system run by a teenager emerge after she pleads guilty to charges including attempting to possess a marketable quantity of cocaine.

title.children: Teen's sophisticated drug distribution system revealed by her notes app

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist?

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: Dick O'Rourke

props.synopsis: A Canberra squash club with half a century of history is slated for apartments, devastating club stalwarts.

title.children: 'Can't just discard us': Dick's beloved squash courts are set to be demolished

image.altText: An older woman and her daughter smiling in a close up photo

props.synopsis: Carers say a "broken sector" is letting down their loved ones with dementia, while a new study shows "confronting" diagnosis delays.

title.children: Some patients wait five years for diagnosis of 'Australia's biggest killer'

image.altText: Magpie thumbail

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has captured footage of the dramatic moment a magpie plucked his earphone from his ear.

title.children: Canberra cyclist captures moment magpie steals earphone from ear

image.altText: A man in white robe standing near a wall with a line of police tape above it

props.synopsis: A witness says the attacker crashed his car and then began "stabbing anyone near him" before trying to get into the synagogue.

title.children: What we know about the Manchester synagogue terror attack

image.altText: Tiffany Wilkes

props.synopsis: Queensland's education minister wouldn't be drawn on reports the girl — who was found dead with her mother at an Airbnb in Kenmore Hills on Monday — had only sporadically been attending school prior to her death.

title.children: Death of 8yo in suspected murder-suicide to be reviewed by education authorities

image.altText: a man with blonde hair wearing a orange hi vis short stands in front of solar panels looking solemn

props.synopsis: The owner of a huge solar farm in outback Queensland hits the kill switch after almost a decade, saying his contract with Ergon Energy was unfair.

title.children: Owner switches off solar farm powering area twice the size of Tasmania

image.altText: A man looks down at his phone as he walks past a white domed building

props.synopsis: While shutdowns have been a possibility since 1976, when Congress introduced the modern budget process, they've been a relatively rare occurrence. Here's a look at how previous shutdowns have played out.

title.children: What the history of US government shutdowns tells us

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police are responding after reports of two bodies that were found in a remote Victorian alpine region.

title.children: Breaking: Emergency operation underway after bodies found near Falls Creek

image.altText: Kawhi Leonard pictured among two people at a game, full stadium behind, smoke bombs going off.

props.synopsis: Kawhi Leonard finds himself at the centre of the NBA's latest salary cap firestorm courtesy of a four-year sponsorship deal signed with a company that went bankrupt. Here's everything we know about the drama and the league's investigation.

title.children: Fraud, trees and missing millions: Kawhi Leonard and the NBA's cheating scandal

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

props.synopsis: NSW Police says the location and expected scale of the rally planned by the Palestinian Action Group poses public safety concerns.

title.children: Opera House 'off-limits' as police bid to move pro-Palestinian rally

image.altText: A plane on the tarmac at night.

props.synopsis: Nearly 3,000 passengers were grounded in the latest incident in a string of drone interferences across European airports, creating heightened fears they could be linked to Russia.

title.children: Germany's Munich Airport reopens after drone sightings stop flights

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man standing next to a woman with a blurred face.

props.synopsis: Como restaurateur Alberto Nicoletti is sentenced for raping a woman he offered to drive home from South Perth, his third sexual assault conviction.

title.children: Woman raped by Perth restaurateur reveals trauma, flashbacks since attack

image.altText: Ali Brigginshaw kicks the ball for the Broncos during 2025 NRLW season.

props.synopsis: The Broncos expect the NRLW grand final to have a State of Origin feel as they look to halt the Sydney Roosters' perfect season.

title.children: Stacked NRLW sides set scene for Origin-style grand final

image.altText: Two men dressed in military uniform holding guns, on a boat.

props.synopsis: According to a UN legal framework, a nation's territory does not extend beyond 19km from its shores but enforcing international maritime law is a challenge across the globe.

title.children: Is Israel breaking the law by stopping the Gaza-bound flotilla?

image.altText: Headshot of woman in jacket from side

props.synopsis: NT Opposition Leader Selena Uibo held a press conference on Friday to disclose the misuse, just days after travel logs were released to the ABC through Freedom of Information.

title.children: NT Labor leader misuses taxpayer-funded chauffeur service for private trips

image.altText: A bundle of leaflets held together by yellow tape. The title says Allegra Spender Exposed

props.synopsis: The Australian Electoral Commission has launched legal action against a finance executive and Wentworth constituent in relation to 47,000 unauthorised pamphlets which were distributed in the electorate during the 2025 election campaign.

title.children: Accused author of unauthorised pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender identified

image.altText: collage of document extracts layer over square colour photo of smiling female teacher and young student wearing hat

props.synopsis: Even after putting a stop to their abuser's access to students, Alliyah faced an uphill battle to get basic information about what had happened behind the scenes.

title.children: Sexual predator taught in Brisbane schools for nine years after parents' complaints

image.altText: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung speaking at a podium

props.synopsis: South Korea President Lee Jae Myung apologises for poorly managed foreign adoption programs that were rife with abuses and fraud, months after the country’s truth commission admits state responsibilities for such practices for the first time.

title.children: South Korea makes Facebook apology for foreign adoption programs

image.altText: A worker waters the ground in the distance while in a tunnel and a excavator works alongside them

props.synopsis: Snowy Hydro says it will need to acquire more funds to deliver the Snowy 2.0 renewable energy project, as costs continue to spiral beyond the previous $10 billion blowout.

title.children: $12 billion Snowy 2.0 project faces further cost blowouts

image.altText: A close up photo of Tony Mokbel.

props.synopsis: The drug kingpin has had a mixed result in his appeal against three convictions, with a possible retrial looming.

title.children: Gangland figure Mokbel faces retrial after spending 6,500 days in prison

image.altText: Hunter S Thompson

props.synopsis: A Colorado sheriff says his office wants to address lingering questions surrounding the author's death.

title.children: Review launched into death of famed journalist Hunter S Thompson

image.altText: Brett Button wearing a suit and tie and glasses walks in to court.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the driver of a bus that crashed in the New South Wales Hunter Valley, killing 10 people, have detailed his appeal against a 32-year sentence.

title.children: 'Too much': Hunter Valley bus crash driver appeals 32-year sentence

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Daniel Billings's defence lawyer tells the court negotiations are in a "fragile place", as the case over the alleged murder of the 28-year-old mother is adjourned.

title.children: Negotiations 'fragile' in Molly Ticehurst murder case, court hears

image.altText: Police operation in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: NSW Police said a member of the public reported seeing four people, one of whom appeared to be carrying a gun, leave a dark-coloured sedan or station wagon and go into a home on the street.

title.children: Hunt for 'aggressive, dangerous men' who slipped Sydney police operation

image.altText: vladimir putin raises his hand as he sits behind a microphone

props.synopsis: The Russian president says it is NATO that is the "paper tiger," and "if anyone still has a desire to compete with us in the military sphere, as we say, feel free, let them try".

title.children: Putin swipes back at Trump's 'paper tiger' comment

image.altText: A stormwater drain

props.synopsis: The City of Yarra mayor has lashed the government over the mapping, saying residents will bear the costs of inadequate infrastructure investment.

title.children: New Melbourne flood mapping sparks outrage from inner-city council

image.altText: A composite of an Asian woman with brown hair wearing pearls and holding up a finger, and Shinjiro Koizum, an Asian man smiling.

props.synopsis: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is stepping down as leader after only a year in the role. It has left his party looking for a new face — and the frontrunner options could not be more different.

title.children: Inflation and Trump changed Japan. Could an 'Iron Lady' or a political scion save it?

image.altText: Fairy lights glow from behind plastic sheets on a building that says "Punka Pub" at dusk.

props.synopsis: Businesses hurt by stay-away orders issued during the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman say they have yet to receive the government support they were promised.

title.children: As the Dezi Freeman manhunt drags on, so do the dark days in Porepunkah

image.altText: A happy beautiful smiling Japanese Akita Inu dog is being petted by a man in a plaid shirt.

props.synopsis: Vets and counsellors say owners can prepare for and address the complicated grief that can come with euthanasing a pet.

title.children: The complicated grief that comes with euthanasing a pet

image.altText: A brown bug with vivid red and blue stripes on its abdomen.

props.synopsis: Whether you love beetles or the giant mantis it's time to cast your vote for Australia's top insect.

title.children: Vote for your favourite Australian Insect of the Year
